title: "G4 Software"

#### Key resources: 
- <b>LED Display Tools</b> [documentation](https://reiserlab.github.io/Modular-LED-Display/)
- <b>GitHub</b> [repository](https://github.com/JaneliaSciComp/G4_Display_Tools).

__________________________

The G4 GUIs are designed to be user-friendly and allow for the generation of patterns, position functions, and experiment designs without needing to write code.

- Generate patterns in the `G4_pattern_generator_gui`.\
See a tutorial on how to create patterns [here](https://reiserlab.github.io/Modular-LED-Display/Generation%204/Display_Tools/docs/pattern-generator_generate_tutorial.html). 

- Generate position functions in the `G4_function_generator_gui`.\
See a tutorial on how to create position functions using the GUI [here](https://reiserlab.github.io/Modular-LED-Display/Generation%204/Display_Tools/docs/function-generator_generate_tutorial.html).

- Design the experiment in the `G4_experiment_designer`.\
Learn more about the experiment designer [here](https://reiserlab.github.io/Modular-LED-Display/Generation%204/Display_Tools/docs/protocol-designer.html).

- Run the experiment in the `G4_experiment_conductor`.\
See an overview on how to use the experiment conductor [here](https://reiserlab.github.io/Modular-LED-Display/Generation%204/Display_Tools/docs/experiment-conductor_getting-started.html).
